website_summaries.verdict: Though it doesn't always live up to its promise to keep out squirrels, its attractive looks and spacious interior make it worth considering.
pros: Sturdy metal construction that's built to last with a design capable of holding up to 8 lbs
Has a cute house design with removable roof for easy refills
cons: The unit doesn't protect seeds from rain or squirrels
It's heavy, especially when full, which limits where you place it

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Be Eating!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this because the squirrels were emptying our old feeder. This feeder worked great for about a week or so attracting many colorful birds that we enjoyed watching. As we pulled into the driveway the other day we saw a squirrel hanging from the weather vane and hanger very much enjoying the deluxe bird seed that we purchased for the birds. It is a cute feeder, but the squirrels quickly learn how to defeat the trap door over the seed. We will keep the feeder, but be warned; it is not squirrel proof!
customer_reviews.author: David E. Price

customer_reviews.title: They can so easily turn the top
customer_reviews.text: Well.......the squirrels be gone alright.....right inside! 2nd day and nearly every day since. They can so easily turn the top, move the lid and sit inside loving the sunflower seeds. I have had 3 of these in the past not sure if same manufacturer and never had this issue. They just aged so I replaced. Very disappointed, I did not reach out to seller because not sure if their fault or I have really clever squirrels. It is not a flimsy product. Only 1 star because I believe it should have a more secure closing on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Ann donnery

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: The birds don’t seem to like the color. Regardless of the type of seed we put in it, water collects in the tray and turns it into a multi goopy mess. We’ve even added some wee polls to get rid of the moisture, but it doesn’t matter. The design is just not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. W. Sumner Davis

customer_reviews.title: Birds do not like it
customer_reviews.text: It is really cute, but the birds do not like it. It is definitely not the seed because we have lots of feeders and use the same feed for all the small birds. It is a very good quality seed for small birds. I have not seen a bird on the feeder at all in 4 1/2 months. The other feeders - nearby - are covered up. that is why we needed another feeder. I think they prefer to be able to get into the feeder, not sit on the edge. Our others are more open.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel BE GONE!!  I love you!
customer_reviews.text: I love this feeder!!! It's heavy when fully loaded so you must hand it on a well supported hook. I am so tired of the squirrels gobbling up all the bird food I put out before the birds have a chance to feed. This feeder's design has an overhead door that closes when their weight is detected and the feeder knows it's not a bird. Well worth the money! you will save on bird food and it will pay for itself over and over.
customer_reviews.author: B Lane

customer_reviews.title: I must have dumb birds in my yard.
customer_reviews.text: They are still taking quite a while to figure out what this is. I think they will though. It is bright red with a metal roof and I love it. I have no idea how well the roof is going to hold up. I am in Austin and we get rain, them blistering sun, then wind, then more sun. The roof does get a little hot in the sun and you have to take it off to put the food in. It is pretty heavy but does not sag on the pole (like my sister does - totally joking, kind of). So far so good. I will update with durability.
customer_reviews.author: David Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder and it IS squirrel proof
customer_reviews.text: My former bird feeders were always monopolized by squirrels, even if I used the inverted bowl. Somehow or other, the squirrels would always find a way to get the food. Since I installed this feeder, the volume of birds in my back yard has vastly increased. I have had the feeder in for a little over a week, and the number of birds is still increasing. The squirrels are completely absent though. I no longer have to replenish an 8# bag of "squirrel seed" every day.
customer_reviews.author: brian414ers

customer_reviews.title: Little Red Barnhouse
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift and I love it. The barnhouse gets a lot of action. It is easy to fill, but it holds so much birdseed that we have only had to refill it once since Christmas. You can either hang it or set it on something flat. I like that you can see through the windows when you need to add more seed. Highly recommend. Update: Got our first squirrel today. He could not get to the birdseed!! He sure tried, but his weight closed the access to the food as built! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Both functional and aesthetically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: From the locking seed bin, to the bird perch this bird feeder is made for the long haul. The green color that I purchased fits in well with the surrounding foliage. I really like the adjustable counter weight spring on the bird perch so that I can actually decide which size birds I want to be able to feed at the station. For this feeders durability, functionality, and esthetic appeal, this was an excellent investment for me and my feathered friends. The metal hanging handle also makes it easy to move the feeder from place to place, without worrying about losing any seed, to enjoy the birds in different locations.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Tricky squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels were able to turn cardinal atop feeder and remove roof. Found them sitting in the feeder. Used a coat hanger hooked on bottom of each side of feeder and ran it through the cardinal. More than one way to defeat those pesky squirrels. But that hasn't stopped them from hanging from roof but they keep sliding off. But now flying squirrels are hitting the feeder at night...pretty cool. They are acceptable with their cuteness factor and how much can they eat being so small. Bring 'em on!
customer_reviews.author: Perry L.

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: Not really that good a product. Seeds do not feed down to the openings readily and they clump. In order to get the seeds to the feeding troughs, I will need to add something to the existing floor to raise the angle. Not being aware of this issue, I had to toss over half the seeds from the first attempt. Now, every other day I go out and tip the unit up so the seeds are in the trough. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John W Gaster

customer_reviews.title: Adorable bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This looks so cute in my yard! It is much more squirrel-proof than my previous feeder. The one issue I have is that the latch that keeps the roof in place isn't very tight, so the squirrels have been able to rotate the rooster (on top), open the latch, and knock off the roof of the feeder. But they didn't actually spill the birdseed on the ground, so I guess that's a plus. I now have two mini-bungee cords holding the roof in place, so even if the squirrels can open the latch, the roof should stay on and protect the seed. The birds love it and are fighting for spots on the perch bar!
customer_reviews.author: Erika Kerekes

customer_reviews.title: Attractive look, but not to the birds!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bird feeder in late September, pole mounted it a couple of days later. Very nice looking, well made too. But - since then, even now, that it has gotten very cold in CT, hardly see any birds feeding. For whatever reason, they don't seem to like it. Not even the squirrels have shown any interest. Never ever had this issue with wooden or plastic bird feeders. Neither of those are that durable, especially not the latter ones. Squirrels chew through the perches etc. Thought a metal feeder would be the answer, birds don't seem to think so.
customer_reviews.author: Koilover

customer_reviews.title: So so so good!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I hoped for when I started looking. It is just my style and it delivers on all points, it looks great, sturdy materials. As far as squirrels go, they have yet to figure it out or try but we will see so far all is well and the birdies took right to it! So happy with this purchase and whole heartedly recommend! UPDATE: Squirrels have yet to open it, however, I did shoo one from the roof haha. More birds than I can count sometimes, I think the red barn really attracts them. I posted some photos, one has like 10 birds in it! Don't think twice about this one!
customer_reviews.author: Parts Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel proof? Not so much. Retardant? Sure, maybe, kinda.
customer_reviews.text: Putting the lid on, tightened properly, can be a bit of a pain. Squirrel proof? No. Our squirrels figured out how to get seed after about three days of trying. They hold on to the top hanger rod thing with one back paw and the other back paw on the roof edge, so as to not put any pressure on the bottom rail, which closes the food presentation openings. Having said that, the squirrels fall off a lot; they do not get nearly as much food as quickly as they do from other feeders. Now we watch the chipmunks stretch out on bottom rail and fill their faces over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stoller

customer_reviews.title: This one definitely has the squirrels baffled
customer_reviews.text: This is the first feeder that is actually difficult for the squirrels to get to! I do help a little by putting WD40 on the top. The only way for the to get to the food is to hang from the roof. The feeder is more than sturdy... it’s actually heavy so if you are using a Shepard’s Hook... get a strong one. The roof comes off for easy filling but getting the top back on is like spinning the roulette wheel. Sometimes you hit the right spot and sometimes you don’t. Overall, I do recommend this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Spaniel Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple feeders and this is one that should last for years. Very well made the roof comes off for filling but the nice part unlike my others Is that the foe weather vane on top is a licking mechanism that hold the roof on in high winds. Already had some storms and it held up great. It does have a way of mounting on pole which I will do this spring I am not a fan of hanging feeders when I have the option. I would recommend this to anyone needing a feeder best value you will find
customer_reviews.author: Debra Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - birds love it - keeps squirrels out
customer_reviews.text: Adorable bird feeder will bring hours of joy if you like to sit out and watch the different birds that visit it. Cardinals and Blue Jays are my favorites and they love the bird feeder. I’m a squirrel fan. Was hoping the bird feeder would have a flaw or two, so they could get their share of feed. No such luck. Ours is hanging on a tree. It will take you a minute to figure out how to attach the exterior handle. Otherwise building the bird feeder is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel was able to open up!
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice metal, well made bird feeder, however believe it or not a very smart squirrel was able to open the top (the weather vane lock is not very tight) and was inside the feeder eating! I will try to get photos but I was so unhappy with the situation I took down the feeder and put it inside my garage. Amazon was nice enough to issue a refund without me having to return the now very soiled feeder. As a side note, I owned the green version of this feeder for 10 years. It doesn't have the weather vane on the top and squirrels were never able to open it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Birds don't like it
customer_reviews.text: We bought these two feeders to replace some older feeders -- one a traditional house shape but with more glass. The other was a cylindrical plastic tube feeder. Both were getting old but attracted tons of birds. After the switch we gave the birds a week to get used to the new feeders, but few came. We decided that it is too hard for birds to see that there were seeds in there. In addition, larger birds such as Stellars jays can't use it as their weight closes the squirrel door.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Not squirrel proof ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I must have intelligent squirrels because they learned to take off the roof pretty quick. The first time i thought maybe i hadn't twisted the roof lock all the way, but then i find the roof off the next 2 mornings after. Coating the roof week Vicks vape run or Vaseline helps some. Now practicing with my BB gun.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and well made!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of thee nicest bird houses I have ever owned! It is quite large and can either be set on a post or hung up. Its very solidly made out of metal, which is well painted in a bright red color. It looks aesthetically good in my back yard. I really love how easy it is to fill with bird feed and to clean out. It also is squirrel and chipmunk proof, it really is. I can't say enough good things about it. The price was a bargain for the size and quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Raisin

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel AND bird proof!
customer_reviews.text: We have many birds at our backyard feeders, but also many squirrels. I was hoping this feeder would take care of the squirrels, but unfortunately it also took care of the birds. I had it hanging in the backyard for several weeks, but never saw any birds using it! There are only 4 tiny holes on one side of the feeder for the birds to access the food, each one smaller than a postage stamp. The bird food is also recessed down inside the holes. With these tiny holes, I don’t think the birds could even smell or sense that there was food for them. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: MN Swede

customer_reviews.title: None of my birds, squirrels or other visitors seem to like it.
customer_reviews.text: A neighbor had given me hers when she moved, and it was an older version, but I used it until it rusted out because it always had a lot of activity at it. This was doesn't seem to interest anyone and the seed goes bad before it gets eater. I've seen very few birds on it and they flock to all my other feeders. Not sure what the problem with it is, but it's not getting the attention I thought it would. Won't be using it anymore. Will probably give it to a friend to see if they have better luck with it. The top comes off easier enough to fill or clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Marian B.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised but can be modified to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these we've owned. The spot welds on the tubular piece which fits over a pole broke. We gave up trying to hang it because the weight of a squirrel causes it to rotate so it no longer hangs upright which it MUST be in order for the seed to move towards the pressure bar (the floor is slanted). In its original design it is NOT squirrel proof. The clear plastic that sits behind the "windows" and "door" is easily chewed through. We replaced it with a sheet of brass we happened to have lying around. We also mounted it on a pole which is cemented into the ground. NOW it is squirrel proof!
customer_reviews.author: Little Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Birds not attracted to this
customer_reviews.text: I hung this next to another feeder containing the same feed. It took the birds a while to discover that it contains food because the feed station is just a small slit on one side of the little house. It attracted just a few small finches, usually one just occasionally. Maybe it's because I hung it next to the other feeder which has a much larger area, on both sides for the birds to perch and feed. They use this one mostly to perch on the roof until there is room at the other feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Emmalee

customer_reviews.title: Well Build Large Feeder
customer_reviews.text: It's really large! It holds lots of birdseed and so far the squirrels haven't figured out how to get to the seed. It is also attractive and can be hung or placed on a pole. I hung it outside my sewing room window to replace the one the squirrels figured out but the birds seem to be afraid of it. I haven't seen a bird eating from it since I hung it on a branch. I am hoping that come fall and winter they will get over what ever they don't like about this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Berthlot

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work without modifications
customer_reviews.text: It’s gorgeous. But with regular mixed feed the larger sunflower seed or anything larger than a small seed won’t come out. I had to bend the slats completely backwards to allow the seed to fall so that the birds could enjoy it. It was a gift for my mother and I hated seeing such a beautiful thing not work. It replaced a 20 year old feeder that Worked but was ugly. Finally after modifying the crap out of it it’s working properly. And no moisture was in it when it we filled it.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca warner

customer_reviews.title: Works well to repel squirrels and is attractive and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Put money and labor time into a free standing pole that my husband kindly put in the ground for me but no birds would come! I figured maybe they were nervous to be out in the open without a tree close by since hawks sometimes come to hunt in my backyard. ☹️ Hung it in a tree and it’s being used all the time now by lots of birds. Squirrels haven’t tried much so far! But...I just saw the same feeder in our local hardware for less money...bummer.
customer_reviews.author: gardengal51

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the critters out
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old wooden feeder which started to be raided by a couple of squirrels who showed up in the neighborhood. Heavy duty and strong also hold a lot of feed and most important can be set to different level of "weight" control to keep small animals and even pigeons from raiding the feed. Took off 1 star as, the Only negative thing is zero instructions on attaching the provided bottom piece, which is plastic, to the feeder, which is all metal, so that it may sit on top of a pole, and with the feeder being all metal and no pre-drill holes it leaves you wondering what they were thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Made of metal! Surprise.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was gone to be cheap metal or some wood. No, sturdy, heavy duty. Better then my home. Bought it for my balcony. I also bought a hook extender so I can watch it while I am at my desk. So fun to see the birds chirping away, my dog loves watching the action. Wish the weather vein would actually work. And I bought two rings so that I can face the front to my window. I am thinking of buying little bulbs to light at night. If my kids will let me. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: HD Bru

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The feeder does seem to attract mostly sparrows and chickadees (I’ve seen one junco, one titmoise, and one woodpecker), but it does seem to be keeping out the squirrels so far. I watched one try to get at the seeds today, but he nearly fell off the slick roof multiple times, and the weight bar worked just as it’s meant to. No doubt he’ll get to the seed eventually, but a week in it’s still keeping them out.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bonczek

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I do like this it’s good for squirrels that try to get bird seed. One thing I do notice is it’s very heavy and made really good . So need a strong stand for it to hang. And I didn’t have a battle on my pole so squirrels will climb to get seed . But they can’t get food which is perfect though they may find the roof of this as a resting destination .i reccomend this and it makes nice yard art as well
customer_reviews.author: Doorah10

customer_reviews.title: Has worked for us!
customer_reviews.text: It's tricky to get it hung where squirrels can't reach (especially large red squirrels) but it is possible. The best part is watching squirrels desperate attempts to leap onto the slippery metal roof or jump from underneath and grab the bar. My primary worry was would the birds be OK with this feeder. Too many squirrels had discouraged them and we had not seen any birds for a couple of months. They are back now! Cardinals, chickadees, mockingbirds, etc. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: No drainage - feeder base holds rain water
customer_reviews.text: Nice capacity, but the seeds get soaking wet and sit in water after rain. There is no drainage at bottom like my other feeder (a screen), and though the base slopes to make the seed slide toward the feeding side, that doesn't actually happen. I kept finding my feeder hanging unlevel with the bottom mostly horizontal rather than inclined. Even if the bottom did slope, the lip that holds the seed also holds water. Fortunately, it rained shortly after I got the feeder so I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but works lousy
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, works lousy. It keeps the squirrels away and the birds too. Quality built material used to build a completely useless bird feeder. Problems: first, the wholes are too small for most seed mixtures. Second, its not rain proof so the seed gets stuck in the small opening and then starts to mildew and sprout. Third, the birds dont like it because its can only be accessed in one direction which makes them uneasy and very cautious. Fourth, its very heavy so after you fill it up, most branches will sag. But hey, it looks great hanging in the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bird feeder but the squirrels still won
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bird feeder though only four starts because I am not sure what squirrels you are up against, the squirrels in our yard figured it out in about a week. They literally hang upside down from the handle by one toe so their face is in the food but they are not actually on the trigger. It is pretty funny to watch and really if they are making that much effort, I am done fighting them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at Wayfair for $71. Figured it’s a steal for $23 on Amazon. This is super high quality. Fits on top of post I had already been using for one of those green steel squirrel proof feeders. Posts are expensive. Never throw them out! This is easy to open by unscrewing cardinal weather vane. It comes with a plastic part and screws if you want to mount it on top of a flat top wood post. We removed the hanger. It’s easy to figure out. Cute and perky. Just right.
customer_reviews.author: Pamfarm

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bird feed 6 years ago from Amazon and put it out every winter. It looks as good as the day I got it. Mine hangs beneath a tree on a metal hook in the ground. I would not say that it is squirrel proof as they have figured out how get to the bird feeder from anearby fence. Periodically does need tobe checked to be sure. It isnot clogged. I onlyfill it 1/4 full at a time. I would definitely buy this again! The birds loveit, but it does take them a couple of weeks each year to realize that it is back out.
customer_reviews.author: leadership lady

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, but not getting many birds even though many birds land on other feeders in yard.
customer_reviews.text: A well designed bird house, however the many birds that visit only go to the "lantern-like" feeders, and seldom go to this one. I though it was because of the weak spring on the perch (designed to close off the seeds if a squirrel gets to the perch), so two birds, or a somewhat larger bird land's on the perch, it closes. I taped the perch open since squirrels can't climb the pole this house is on, but it doesn't seem to help in attracting more birds.
customer_reviews.author: SubVet608

customer_reviews.title: I love this bird feeder!!
customer_reviews.text: Bird feeder is on the larger size which is exactly why I wanted it. I live on a farm so the cute barn design goes perfect with the setting. It took the birds nearly two weeks to get to used to it, but once they did they now come around daily. No issues with the paint fading in direct sun. Metal shell with plastic "windows". Holds up very well in stormy/windy weather as well. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Monkeynboo

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to remove top to add food
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product. It is a sturdy metal item and thought it would be great and last a long time outside. However, you take off the top to fill it and then it is extremely difficult to hook the top back on. I couldn't do it without tipping the feeder over so I could see how the top hooks on. I didn't even try to put on the wire hanger. Sent it back for immediate full refund which was appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Patti S

customer_reviews.title: I thought getting this would be a great idea to keep the them from eating the bird ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive bird house. We have a lot of squirrels. I thought getting this would be a great idea to keep the them from eating the bird food. The problem I am having is that something (I assume squirrels) keep trying to eat the feed. At least once a week I find that it on the ground or hanging on its side. The problem is, the silver metal piece that hangs the house keeps getting knocked out when the squirrels try to eat the food. The house literally hangs on its side or ends up on the ground. Luckily the house hasn't broken yet, but Its quite annoying that the hanging piece comes out so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Feather

customer_reviews.title: We call it the "Little Red Barn"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and manufactured for quality and ease of cleaning and refilling. Turn the top vane and the roof comes off --- fill or clean --- relock the roof with one simple twist of the vane. This one has proven to be squirrel proof --- we have had several in the past and squirrels have always figured out how to manipulate them but not this one (and we have a lot of squirrels).
customer_reviews.author: John's Comments

customer_reviews.title: Rusted in 1 day!
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday. Filled with seed and put it up on the pole. It rained last night. Apparently one of the backyard birds has unusually sharp claws that scratched the copper-colored tin roof. It has rusted already! I'm going to remove the rust and apply a couple of coats of clear outdoor furniture paint and hope that solves the rust issue. I won't buy this model again, any case.
customer_reviews.author: rare bird

customer_reviews.title: My best ever bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels were tearing up my bird feeders. I finally bought a small squirrel proof feeder but tired of filling it daily. My husband bought me this one for my birthday and it’s the best present I could get! Zero squirrels trying to break into it, it holds weeks worth of seed and the birds (after 3 months of suspicious avoidance) decided they love it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieRoo

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely presented, little shaky on build and paint
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift, it works well and appears nice out of the box. Installing it and getting a feel for it, it is a bit on the "thin build" side. It will be interesting to see how it holds up over time. I'm guessing some rust will appear and some of the movable parts will become less so. But as for now, it works well, recipient was happy, squirrels not so happy. And it does do pretty good at thwarting the acrobatic tree rats.
customer_reviews.author: General consumer

customer_reviews.title: Ready to hang right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a new region and are in a temporary home while we build a house. Most of my feeders are still in a box in a garage so I decided to buy a new one. Very happy with my purchase of this feeder. It was ready to go right out of the box. Attracted birds within a few days. One month in, we have many birds coming to this feeder. Love to sit on the deck and watch the bird activity.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped squirrels for a few days...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped squirrels for a few days, until they figured out how to beat the system by grabbing the hang bar with their rear paws and hanging down over the overhang to dig the food out of the holes with their front paws, all without touching the perch. In the few days it took them to figure it out, they scratched and chewed the corners of the birdhouse, exposing the metal underneath, which will now rust. I'm going to try another bird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: R20116M

customer_reviews.title: This feeder definitely keeps out the squirrels, I've watched ...
customer_reviews.text: This feeder definitely keeps out the squirrels, I've watched squirrels try getting in there and and they've been unsuccessful. However, I've had this feeder now for two weeks almost and I've only seen a humming bird go to it, that's not enough. We have cardinals, woodpeckers and a few other smaller species. I have the lever all the way pushed down so I don't understand why the birds aren't coming. The bird feed is fresh so I'm not understanding the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this feeder
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality bird feeder. Easy to refill. Easy to adjust the tension lever to deter squirrels. -- We still had a squirrel issue, however, but mainly because we have one squirrel who figured it out. We named him Einstein, because he could get to the food without shutting the feeder access. No other squirrels could do that; just Einstein. So, we opted to give him some ground access food. The little guy earned it. -- This feeder, though, is very nice and I'm glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: LH Designs

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but squirrels figure it out
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit. It’s very cute and holds a ton of seed. Squirrels will figure it out though. Ours would climb on the roof of the barn and hang a leg from the rooster so they could stretch down and eat seed without triggering the weight sensitive lever. We had to still buy a baffle for the pole to keep the squirrels at bay. But overall it’s a very cute bird feeder and we find many birds flocking to it.
customer_reviews.author: hollyann

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but what's the point?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sturdy, beautiful feeder because the squirrels had a heyday with our previous plastic feeder. While the feeder is sturdy and beautiful, we haven't seen a SINGLE bird feed from it since putting in it out almost a month ago?! They are scared of it, don't like it, something?! I'm not sure what it is, but what's the point of having a feeder if the birds won't feed?? Sad about this...
customer_reviews.author: Alecia Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Makes an excellent gift ....
customer_reviews.text: This Bird Feeder is quite sturdy, durable and holds a ton of bird feed. It was fairly easy to install. We have many, many squirrels on our property and so far they have not been able to get into the feeder. I would recommend placing it between 5 - 7 feet above the ground and away from any fences near the feeder itself. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: The Tusk

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: We love this feeder. It was very well-boxed and came with some instructions, but they could have been better. My husband made some adjustments and it works well. So far the squirrels have not figured it out, but they get peanuts every morning along with many varieties of birds. We have so much wildlife as we are close to a creek. The opossums and raccoons can be a nuisance, but their babies are sure cute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless feeder
customer_reviews.text: After sending two messages to product support and NOT receiving any response I want folks to know I had trouble with the feed clogging up at the opening and making the feeder useless. I had to dump the feed out and start over. There are three small holes close to the front however if moisture is the problem it's not working. Now I will just dump the feeder in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Metal strong attractive bird house
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to mount to our homemade screen catcher utilizing the pole adapter that it came with. Allows us to lift bird house up if we need to clean. Also liked that it is sturdy so we are hoping it will last for a while. Handle easy to remove. Used a small peace of tape to cover handle hole FROM INSIDE so seed couldn't leak out. Only suggestion is the roof attaching is challenging maybe a larger grabber inside? even trying to align the weathervane to turn took few attempts. With the amount of food it holds we should not have to fill everyday. great product for outdoor weather.
customer_reviews.author: MKD

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw leads to moldy seed
customer_reviews.text: There is a design flaw that traps seed below where the birds can get to it. This trough also traps moisture which leads to moldy seed. The mold then spreads up into the other seed until it plugs the opening completely. I originally thought that the moldy seed was due solely to Seattle's wet winter, but I filled the feeder again during drier weather, and it still gets moldy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Eaton

customer_reviews.title: I kind of like 'misplaced' seeds b/c that draws in the ground feeders ...
customer_reviews.text: This feeder holds a lot of feed and even though I read some reviews about the sunflower seeds getting jammed up, haven't had a problem. As a matter of fact, I save a lot of money with this b/c the seed doesn't fall all over the ground! (the drawback with that is, I kind of like 'misplaced' seeds b/c that draws in the ground feeders like Morning Doves, Cardinals, and Jay's!! Other than that, it's awesome and fits in with the rest of my 'decor'.
customer_reviews.author: michelle backlas

customer_reviews.title: How sturdy it is made
customer_reviews.text: I will start off by saying it’s more sturdy on a pole! Go to Home Depot and buy a 1/2”x72” long threaded galvanized pole! The pole will thread right into the pole adapter the bird feeder comes with. Last thing is make the roof extra squirrel proof. Again at Home Depot buy: Wire rope Rope clamp Eye bolt with nuts Use you imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon D.

customer_reviews.title: Ird feeder is a wonderfully strong and sturdy one
customer_reviews.text: This. Ird feeder is a wonderfully strong and sturdy one. Getting the roof to lock on takes abit of fiddling but is not impossible at all. Love that it holds so much but does require a.VERY strong shepherds hook or other means to hang it. My birds love it and squirrels are not an issue for me so cannot comment on that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Dorthy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love this and the birds, too!!!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this bird feeder with high hope to seduce lots of birds but no birds showed for about a week. My son gave an idea to open the roof cover and it worked!! As you can see the attached video, birds love this feeder and my whole family is enjoying to watch them so much. It is really fun to have this feeder. It reduced my TV watching time because watching birds is more fun than TV. I love this bird feeder and the birds, too!!!
customer_reviews.author: NRW

customer_reviews.title: The worst designed bird feeder ever. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: It is not only squirrel proof but also bird proof. This is easy the worst bird feeder I ever bought. The seed openings are too small and the perch is too wide. The birds won’t sit on it and the birds flutter around in utter confusion. No draining holes for rain water so you end up with moldy compacted seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Tim2ZA

customer_reviews.title: Birds are unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 months ago. I've seen just a few birds even attempt to feed on it. They just don't like it. The feeding tray openings are so small that a lot of types of seed get trapped in it. I also think the perch is too small for most birds to sit on. Finches and Cardinals avoid it altogether. It does look good sitting out in my yard, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money saved - don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This product was about $20 and a very similar one at Home Depot was $36 - so I bought this one. Unfortunately, there are several things wrong. Water gets in it (a lot of feeders have that problem I guess so not a huge deal). The little top square piece that holds the lid down broke off. Today, I found the entire roof flipped off of it. I went and bought the similar one from Home Depot today. It's made a little differently, so I'll see if it holds up better.
customer_reviews.author: S. E.

customer_reviews.title: The feeder is squirrel-proof because the bar on the front lowers when too much weight is applied
customer_reviews.text: In case it is not clear, the feeder is squirrel-proof because the bar on the front lowers when too much weight is applied. I love this bird feeder. It is beautiful and makes an excellent addition to our garden. It took me a moment to figure out how the top comes off, and the box did not come with instructions. However, we figured it out after a few minutes. If you need to know, the weathervane twists, unlocking the top.
customer_reviews.author: sweden

customer_reviews.title: A House for Happy Birds
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive and durable product. In a year outside under a tree, in wind, rain and sun, it has hardly weathered at all. Sometimes metal looks shabby after awhile, but the paint on this one has stayed a lovely bright green, just the way the picture looks. The large size is nice. Although it is a little awkward to fill, once filled it lasts a long time. I love the look, too––a glimpse of bright copper among the green. Everything needed in a sturdy feeder, I believe it is squirrel-proof although ours have disappeared lately and I can't swear to that. Based on this first year, I would guess this feeder will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Here to Help

customer_reviews.title: Welding error during manufacture
customer_reviews.text: This is a good-looking birdfeeder, but a simple defect in manufacturing made it impossible to install without considerable filing. The circular hole at the bottom of the feeder, which is supposed to accept a 1" pipe, had a blob of welding material that blocked our existing pipe (left over from a previous birdfeeder). I had to laboriously file down that blob with a rat-tail file to make the hole perfectly round. In my opinion, this was a defect in the welding, and ALSO a defect in inspection. Neither should have happened. Regardless, we have now filled it with birdseed and are eagerly awaiting its trial by squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cobb

customer_reviews.title: My birds wouldn’t use it
customer_reviews.text: I left this feeder out for weeks in the same location as my old one and the birds didn’t use it. Same location and food. I ended up taking it down, cleaning and repairing my old feeder and putting the old one back. This is a really cute feeder and it’s squirrel proof. I don’t understand why it didn’t work in my yard. Red color? Silver roof? Who knows?
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: Great bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Great bird feeder. I thought the squirrels had managed to knock it down and destroy it. The company quickly replaced it since they warranteed It for a year. Unfortunately, the second one was also destroyed and I will not ask to have it replaced since the culprit was a bear. Must have been a bear the first time ( I thought it wasn't possible since we live in a town) Can't expect it to stand up to a bear, so my feeding days are over.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne K

customer_reviews.title: Quality Feeder but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality feeder. The paint is perfect and the feeder can be mounted on a pole with the included adapter or hung on a hook. The birds did not like the feeder. They sat on the roof to wait for a place on the feeder that we put sunflower seeds in. During a rainstorm, the seeds got wet and the water wicked up into the feeder house and got all the seeds wet and moldy. We sent this feeder back.
customer_reviews.author: George Sverlow

customer_reviews.title: Birds seem to like it and squirrel dont.
customer_reviews.text: I hung mine from those hooks you stick in the ground. It's hanging 4ft.off the ground and away from trees the squirrel can leap from to the feeder. I put a rubber gasket where the latch you turn to unlock the roof goes, to keep out rain. Other than that. IT'S BEAUTIFUL. Really a sight and for the money, a very good buy. I don't mind the feeder maintenance, it's worth the enjoyment of having it and seeing what birds you can attract.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Deters the Squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I have several feeders and lots of squirrels to discourage. I use hot pepper seed in this and have no problems - the feeder is difficult for the squirrels to maneuver around, but the birds are happy. Solid construction, locking lid, holds a lot of seed and has a very visible feed window so it’s easy to see from the house if it needs filling. Floor also slopes down to the perch so the seed flows where it should. I’ve had mine for a year and the color has held up well (other well-known feeders have “absolute”ly not fared as well as this one). I just ordered a second one, so I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not squirrel proof.
customer_reviews.text: Great in many ways. But it isn't squirrel proof. The little cupola which is used to lock the roof in place after filling serves as a great handle for the squirrel to hold on to while he leans over the edge and eats out of the trough and never touches it with his front paw. Least squirrel proof squirrel proof feeder I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: shirtlake

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome value! Hard to believe the price was this low, all metal with a locking tin roof. A bit concerned squirrels will eventually chew through the plastic windows which can easily be fixed if the did, but such a great value Love it! 1 month update- still a great purchase. Squirrels still try and still get frustrated . This is an incredible design, a great value! Zero regret . Thank you, glad I own it!
customer_reviews.author: Tenga Tom

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels are gone (with a little help).
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels did manage to invade it by hanging upside down and defeating the little closing lever. However, I sprayed cooking oil on the tin roof and that tactic came to an end. We also had a lot of laughs watching the squirrels sliding off before they could get a grip on anything. They were defeated so many times that they actually gave up. Have had the most success with this feeder and my little train lantern feeder (has no place a squirrel can get hold of and feeding station is friendly only to birds.
customer_reviews.author: mnewman743

customer_reviews.title: Really does foil the squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: It really is squirrel-proof. I bought one for my mother for Christmas 2011 when she was so frustrated by squirrels emptying her bird feeders. She gleefully reported that they cannot get into it. She's been so pleased with hers that when I recently decided to set up a bird feeding station I bought one for myself. It's very attractive, I think, with the green color and copper roof, and is sturdy. Mom is still using hers, and it's still keeping the squirrels out. The green color has faded a bit on hers, but it's been outside constantly for 4 1/2 years through bad winters and blazing summers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a really pretty bird feeder, don't buy it. We have not had one bird come to feed from it. The reason is, the birds can't get the food out of it. It is advertised as adjustable, bit it is not adjustable. This is not inexpensive, and it's a waste of money. I reached out to the manufacturer twice, but never received a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: Product with one great flaw
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of this bird feeder and the sturdiness but it's difficult to lock the roof. However, the aspect that has quickly become a problem is that then it rains and the seed in the little openings gets wet, then the whole feeder clogs and it's difficult to clean it out and open it up again. I just struggled with it this morning after a hard rain two days ago. The bird feeder is expensive and I think I will return it as I don't relish continuing to be frustrated by this aspect in future. My lovely birds deserve better!
customer_reviews.author: llhoroho

customer_reviews.title: A must have for birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding birds for many years and I find watching birds up close very therapeutic. This feeder is super cool on a number of levels. Number one, the feeder looks great and adds color and pizazz to any garden or landscape. Two, the adjustable feeder bar is perfect for keeping large birds, squirrels, and other unwanted animals from hogging all of the feed. Three, the feeder is well made from sturdy materials and the top removed easily for easy filling. Finally, the feeder keeps the feed bone dry even in the heaviest of storms. All of this at a marvelous price...very rare in this world.
customer_reviews.author: President & CEO

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I have had their hummingbird feeder for probably 15 years and looked forward to this feeder. I hung my feeder from a shepherd's hook. The handle is too short and kept unlocking the weathervane on top of the feeder and the top kept falling off. I then hung it from a piece of rope and then from the hook again. I went to fill it today and the weathervane completely broke apart and the top was off on the ground again. I am extremely disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lily08

customer_reviews.title: it is working!
customer_reviews.text: squirrels are opening up the hood and eating up all the seeds. There is a silver color screw type thing on the hood. Is it supposed to screw up and stop the squirrel? It is very loose for me. So I can not screw it up. Is mine defective? Please let me know. Called support with this question. They are very helpful. The top screw should line up with the hole on the bar and squirrels. should not be able to get in. very happy with the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Lal Chakraborty

customer_reviews.title: Love this Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This was my mother's day gift. I was tired of fighting the squirrels. And this was the answer! It looks great! It holds 8 lbs of birdseed. My only warning is to make sure you hang it from something very sturdy or like us put it on a 4x4. It is easy to fill and easy to use and it comes assembled. I highly recommend this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Nanette M. Polito

customer_reviews.title: Not good as a hanging feeder
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy feeder, and probably does well on a pole, but not for hanging. Falls either forward or backward, does not stay even or balanced, so not really bird friendly. Too bad. Also, assembly of the hangar to the feeder needs instructions, a real IQ test. Finally figured that out, so now disappointed in the whole doesn't hang right issue.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bird feeder ever. Sturdy. Weather proof. It is also the best squirrel feeder ever as the the video shows. We have a lot of red and grey squirrels and it takes them just minutes to figure out how to make it a squirrel feeder. If you can make this feeder out of bounds to squirrels it is the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: jonathon patrick zink

customer_reviews.title: Don't Understand Why Birds Won't Use.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the problem is, but the birds won't go near it. I have it set to the strongest setting for weight. I've tried everything by incorporating the old feeder above, below, around, etc. to entice them. Nothing seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy feeder
customer_reviews.text: Well made. It holds a lot of seed so needs something heavy to hold it. It looks so nice in my yard. The spring holding the perch is sensitive enough to keep out pigeons (the main reason I bought it). A good gift for your bird loving friends. You do need to take it down to fill it but you would expect that from such a large feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blain

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the new version
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Squirrel-Be-Gone feeder, so we obviously like them and they do work as advertised. We did find a problem with this newer design however. The older model had a flat, square latch mechanism to hold the roof on. The new model has a cute stand-up profile of a cardinal. When squirrels get on top of the roof, their bodies turn this profile and open the latch. With the latch released, they can lift off the roof and get to the food. This has happened three times.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT SQUIRREL PROOF
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is well built and attractive but is not squirrel proof. The squirrels first got the top off which we were able to secure and next they raised the plastic “windows” and crawled right in. It took them less than an hour. The birds liked the feeder, the few minutes that they were able to use it. Design modifications are needed
customer_reviews.author: Rwint

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful feeder, don't overload when hanging!
customer_reviews.text: I love looking at this feeder! It's gorgeous and I have it HANGING - NOT STATIONARY. I have noticed with too much seed inside, then the wind can blow so hard it moves the seed to that it doesn't sit level which on rainy days means it doesn't drain in the seed window area. I drilled extra holes to help but I think the only thing that will really help is putting it on the post, anchored. So, learn from my experience! :P
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beats squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to fill and hang. All birds seem to like it and adjusted to it in 24 hours, large capacity hopper makes filling less frequent. Squirrels 90% defeated by the design (A squirrel can learn to hang from the roof and access the feed), a quick shot of cooking spray on the roof yielded 100% effective result against local squirrel population, and added greatly to entertainment value of feeder. I had my doubts about the roof/ hopper lock, but it has held fine. I left the counterbalance spring lose, this makes it harder for large pest birds to monopolize the feeder . Very nice addition to backyard overall.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: My birds are happy and the squirrels are not!
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy built bird feeder. Attractive to look at and the cardinals and doves finally enjoy perching on a feeder that is big enough to support them. The squirrels cant really get to the seed because they are too heavy and the perch lowers to cover the seed when they hang on it, so it does the trick! The only issue I have is when the squirrels are trying to get to the seed, they end up moving the weight pin out of position and I am constantly having to move it back again.
customer_reviews.author: mary s.

customer_reviews.title: The hanger is not usable.
customer_reviews.text: The hanger is impossible to use to hang the bird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun with nature
customer_reviews.text: I really like the bird feeder and the way it looks. I must have very bright squirrels as a couple have devised a way to hang from the roof and lean down to get to the seed. That way they aren't flipped by the bar on the front. At first I was a little upset and then I just laughed. I have since purchased a bafflle and figured out a way to mount it. So far it seems to be working. Always interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Sister K.

customer_reviews.title: The best feeder I own!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bird feeder so much and so do the birds! One thing that impresses me is how much seed is consistently in the feeder compared to my other feeders, so little waste falling to the ground. It looks great hanging from the tree. It's probably my favorite feeder of all of my feeders. Very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel proof.
customer_reviews.text: The little girl next door likes to watch the birds eat out of the little red barn. Squirrels are baffled when they close the feeder entrance by stepping on it. Hold a lot of food so don’t have to fill very often. Wish the key at the top would seat into the feeder a little easier though. Takes a little finagling to clamp down top.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Miles Cary

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels laugh at this feeder as they happily munch of the seeds
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels laugh at this feeder as they happily munch of the seeds! They just lean over the roof of the thing and munch that way. Every squirrel in the neighborhood comes over for the buffet. I bought a $165 pole which I hope will do a better job in keeping them out. If it doesn't work, I'll get a new feeder. This produce SHOULD be called, "Buffet for Squirrels."
customer_reviews.author: S. Stulz

customer_reviews.title: Great Bird Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I used this bird feeder on a tall pole with a baffle to keep the squirrels off, it works! Beat of all the birds just love it! Easy to use to fill and clean and just looks great! It holds plenty of feed so it last a while between fill-ups! I highly recommend this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: William Yarberry

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Bird Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This bird feeder is so much larger and nicer than I expected. It’s a beautiful brilliant red that I hope doesn’t rust. It held the entire 5 pound bag of black oil sunflower seeds, a big plus to me since I won’t have to have seeds laying around. The only difficulty was assembling it- it took me a while to figure out some steps because they don’t look exactly like the pictures. A more competent person probably wouldn’t have a problem. I would also like to say it is much cheaper than I have seen elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Donner

customer_reviews.title: Unable to stop the squirrels
customer_reviews.text: This is not squirrel proof in my yard. The squirrels are able to unscrew the top, throw the cover off and sit inside and eat til their hearts content. Any tree I can reach has limbs near enough for them to jump. The trees that have no lower limbs for them to jump from, I have no way to hang.
customer_reviews.author: ALLISON YARROW

product_meta.title: Perky-Pet 338 Squirrel-Be-Gone II Country House Bird Feeder with Weathervane, 8 Lb, Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedTurn your yard into a bird lovers' paradise with this Perky-Pet Squirrel-Be-Gone II Country Style Bird Feeder. Attract everything from cardinals, finches, flickers, and grackles to grosbeaks, jays, and juncos. This bird feeder provides an optimal feeding station for birds, without catering to those sneaky squirrels. It does so by utilizing a weight-activated perch that closes off under a squirrel’s weight, while your favorite birds can still access the seed just fine. Adjustable springs can be calibrated to accommodate different bird sizes and keep away large nuisance birds as well. In addition, this feeder boasts an all-metal construction to resist squirrel damage and a powder-coated finish to resist rust. For your convenience, this feeder can be hung on a hook or pole mounted to allow versatile placement (and help with your squirrel prevention measures). The removable metal roof reveals a large opening that enables easy filling and cleaning. This feeder is able to hold up to 8 lb of black-oil sunflower seed, hulled sunflower seed, mixed seed, or safflower seed so it’s sure to keep your hungry birds happy and well fed.
feature_bullets: Weight-activated perch closes off ports under squirrels’ weight
Durable, all-metal construction stands up against squirrels
Removable roof and large opening for easy filling
Powder-coated finish provides rust resistance and durability
Can be hung or pole mounted for versatile placement
Holds up to 8 pounds of black-oil sunflower seed, hulled sunflower seed, mixed seed, or safflower seed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,200 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
